name: Injecting Logical Background Knowledge into Embeddings for Relation Extraction
abstraction: Most Web-based Q/A systems work by find- ing pages that contain an explicit answer to a question. These systems are helpless if the answer has to be inferred from multiple sen- tences, possibly on different pages. To solve this problem, we introduce the HOLMES sys- tem, which utilizes textual inference (TI) over tuples extracted from text. Whereas previous work on TI (e.g., the lit- erature on textual entailment) has been ap- plied to paragraph-sized texts, HOLMES uti- lizes knowledge-based model construction to scale TI to a corpus of 117 million Web pages. Given only a few minutes, HOLMES doubles recall for example queries in three disparate domains (geography, business, and nutrition). Importantly, HOLMES's runtime is linear in the size of its input corpus due to a surprising property of many textual relations in the Web corpusâ€”they are "approximately" functional in a well-defined sense.
